rules.rationale: 'neuropsych' prefix tables (forms A through F) contain standardized neuropsychological test batteries. Cognitive impairment is a major outcome in urea cycle disorders due to hyperammonemia. 121-400 vars per form. Pure — each form is a specific test battery.
Truncated name variant 'p5101_16898_neuropsyc' — same neuropsychological testing as the neuropsychform* tables. 15 vars.
Validated QoL instruments: SF-36 (adults) and PedsQL 4.0 (pediatric, parent and child report versions). Each table is a single standardized instrument. 30-43 vars each.
